meanings.definition: A solid exterior angle of a wall or building.
meanings.sent1: The old castle had a large quoin at the corner of the tower.
meanings.sent2: The mason carefully crafted the quoin to fit perfectly into the wall.
meanings.sent3: When the bird landed on the quoin, it looked like a tiny perch for a moment.
meanings.sent4: The quoin of the building stood out like a proud soldier at attention.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight cast a shadow on the quoin, highlighting its unique shape.

meanings.definition: A wedge-shaped piece of wood or metal used in printing to lock up type.
meanings.sent1: The printer inserted the quoin to secure the letters in place for printing.
meanings.sent2: After tightening the quoin, the typesetter was ready to start the press.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted the quoin across the table, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a quoin, locking his thoughts in place with precision.
meanings.sent5: The quoin slid into position with a satisfying click, ready for the next page.
